lead_paragraph: Beijing is using the anniversary of the Long March, which established Mao’s pre-eminence, in an effort to sow patriotic fervor and strengthen loyalty to the Communist Party.

headline.print_headline: With Odes to Military March, China Puts Nationalism Into Overdrive
headline.main: With Odes to Military March, China Puts Nationalism Into Overdrive

snippet: Beijing is using the anniversary of the Long March, which established Mao’s pre-eminence, in an effort to sow patriotic fervor and strengthen loyalty to the Communist Party....
abstract: Chinese government embraces nationalistic displays in its cultural events, and latest endeavor, opera The Long March, honors early days of Chinese Communist Party; performances staged at National Center for the Performing Arts in Beijing offer unambiguous propaganda message--that Chinese citizens should seek to emulate ideals of self-sacrifice and perseverance demonstrated by soldiers of the Long March.
